texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: A coworker heard me grumbling about Linux system administration standards and recommended that I review the  CIS Security Benchmarks . After downloading the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 security benchmark PDF, I quickly started to see the value of the document. Some of the standards were the installation defaults, some were often forgotten settings, and some were completely brand new to me.
texts.text: A coworker heard me grumbling about Linux system administration standards and recommended that I review the  CIS Security Benchmarks . After downloading the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 security benchmark PDF, I quickly started to see the value of the document. Some of the standards were the installation defaults, some were often forgotten settings, and some were completely brand new to me.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Automating the standards can be a little treacherous simply due to the number of things to adjust and check. I've created a kickstart for CentOS 6 and tossed it on Github:
texts.text: Automating the standards can be a little treacherous simply due to the number of things to adjust and check. I've created a kickstart for CentOS 6 and tossed it on Github:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Be sure to read the disclaimers in the  README  before getting started. Also, keep in mind that the kickstarts are in no way approved by or affiliated with the  Center for Internet Security  in any way. This is just something I'm offering up to the community in the hope that it helps someone.
